page.title: 20Attitudes Flintham/Syerston.
page.content:
Because of the lack of facilities, most newcomers to the villages have made a conscious decision to live here and so there is a high level of car ownership. There is a general pride in the appearance of the villages and in retaining their characters. Many of the teenagers may not enjoy their lives as there is so little for them to do, but the other residents seem to enjoy living here.
Those helping in this project by researching and/or writing were: Mike Ansell, David Bishop, Kathy Clark, Sue and Trevor Clayton, Chris and David Ditchum, Helen Dobbs, Myles Hildyard, Anita and Peter Hitchings, Freida Klingbeil, Mary Oxley and Pam Russell.
Flintham Primary School and Toothill School Bingham provided the computers.
